org.gearvrf.utility

Class Threads.ThreadLimiter<CANCELABLE extends Threads.Cancelable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.utility.Threads.ThreadLimiter<CANCELABLE>
  • Enclosing class:
    Threads

    public static class Threads.ThreadLimiter<CANCELABLE extends Threads.Cancelable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Limits the number of (thread pool) threads running at any one time. A stand-alone class, as different subsystems may have different limits, based on the resources their threads consume. Each subsystem that instantiates a thread limiter must supply an implementation of Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider, or use the standard Threads.LifoThreadPolicyProvider.

    • Constructor Summary

      Create a new thread limiter, with a default slow-thread timeout.
      ThreadLimiter(int maxThreads, Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider<CANCELABLE> policy, int slowThreadTimeout)
      Create a new thread limiter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadLimiter

        public ThreadLimiter(int maxThreads,
                     Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider<CANCELABLE> policy)
        Create a new thread limiter, with a default slow-thread timeout.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - Maximum number of threads that can run at once.
        policy - Manages pool of pending threads, deciding which should run next.

      • ThreadLimiter

        public ThreadLimiter(int maxThreads,
                     Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider<CANCELABLE> policy,
                     int slowThreadTimeout)
        Create a new thread limiter.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - Maximum number of threads that can run at once.
        policy - Manages pool of pending threads, deciding which should run next.
        slowThreadTimeout - If we try to start a new thread and any thread has gone more than this many milliseconds since starting, we will create a new thread, and drop back down to maxThreads when/if the slow thread returns.

    • Method Detail

      • spawn

        public void spawn(CANCELABLE threadProc)
        Run a thread proc, on a thread from the system thread pool. Thread will run immediately, if possible. If the maximum number of threads are already running, the thread proc will be added to a pool, and scheduling will be determined by the ThreadPolicyProvider.

      • reschedule

        public void reschedule(CANCELABLE threadProc)
        Run immediately, if possible; else, schedule threadProc to run next.
